titleStmt.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Judgment and Decree

bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Judgment and Decree
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Chung Him and Seid Yam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
In the Matter of the Application of Chung Him and Seid Yam, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now on this day the above matter having come on for hearing before the court upon the return of the respondent, Henry M. White, for the writ of habeas corpus heretofore issued, which said writ was issued pursuant to the order of this court dated December 2, 1920, the petitioners appearing in person and by their attorney of record, J.L. Corrigan, Esquire, and the respondent appearing by the United States District Attorney, and the court having considered the evidence consisting of the record of the Department of Labor, upon which record the order of deportation was issued by the Secretary of Labor, and having fully considered the return of the said respondent, and being if the opinion that the petitioners are unlawfully restrained of their liberty, and that the said order of deportation was without authority of law, and being of the opinion that the petitioners should be released from the custody of the Immigration authorities and of the officers of the Department of Labor, and particularly from the custody of Henry M. White, respondent herein, it is, therefore,
ORDERED, ADJUDGED and DECREED that the petitioners, CHUNG HIM and SEID YAM be and they are hereby released and
discharged, and the said respondent, Henry M. white, and all persons acting under his authority be, and they are hereby, ordered to release the said petitioners and each of them;

And it is further ordered that in view of the announcement in open court by the United States Attorney of his intention forthwith to appeal to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, that the said petitioners shall be released from custody pending the determination of said appeal only upon the furnishing by each petitioner of bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1.000.), as is more fully provided in that certain order of this date concurrently signed, filed and entered herein.
DONE in open court this 6th day of December, 1920.
